blog.title: A Ravenclaw Hogwarts Mystery
blog.description: A Hogwarts Mystery Game Blog

summary: I like to think that our MCs inspire Fred and George with their troublemaking ways. I mean we break the rules so often, going...
body:
I like to think that our MCs inspire Fred and George with their troublemaking ways. I mean we break the rules so often, going against basically everything Dumbledore tells us to do, and still can end up being able to win the house cup on our own.

I really hope we will be able to interact with them in the game. Fingers crossed

summary: Blu-ray e DVD de Animais Fantásticos: Os Crimes de Grindelwald ganham data de lançamento no Brasil
title: Blu-ray e DVD de Animais Fantásticos: Os Crimes de Grindelwald ganham data de lançamento no Brasil
description:
As edições em home video de Animais Fantásticos: Os Crimes de Grindelwald serão lançadas no país no dia 26 de fevereiro de 2019. A informação foi revelada pela loja especializada FamDVD.

No Brasil, o filme será lançado em pelo menos três edições: blu-ray simples, blu-ray 3D + 2D e em DVD. Assim como o primeiro filme, é possível que o novo lançamento também receba uma edição em steelbook, mas este ainda não foi confirmado. Ainda não há informações sobre a pré-venda, preços ou bônus especiais da edição brasileira.

(adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
Clique para exibir o slide.

Na Europa, o lançamento ocorre um mês mais tarde, em 20 de março, em blu-ray, blu-ray 3D, DVD, steelbook e 4K UHD, com preços que variam entre 20 e 35 euros.

Uma edição especial, contendo o steelbook UHD 4K, blu-ray 3D, 2D e cópia digital também será lançada na Europa, em edição limitada de 950 cópias. O diferencial da edição, que será lançada ao preço de 330 euros, é sua embalagem, que imita a maleta de Newt Scamander, replicando a habilidade de que os conteúdos da maleta apareçam de maneira diferente para bruxos e trouxas.

Escrito por J.K. Rowling e dirigido por David Yates, Animais Fantásticos: Os Crimes de Grindelwald é o segundo filme da série protagonizada por Newt Scamander. Em cartaz nos cinemas brasileiros desde 15 de novembro de 2018, o filme tem como protagonistas Eddie Redmayne, Katherine Waterston, Alison Sudol e Dan Fogler, com Johnny Depp no papel de Gerardo Grindelwald e Jude Law como Alvo Dumbledore.

The post Blu-ray e DVD de Animais Fantásticos: Os Crimes de Grindelwald ganham data de lançamento no Brasil appeared first on Potterish.com.

blog.name: thesnapewecandreamof
blog.title: Half-Blood Quinn
blog.description:
20 |Pro-Snape Blog|| Dumpster for headcanons and plotbunnies || Everything Severus Snape|| Side-Blog|| Asks and request are welcomed
Main blog is TheLazyBAMF 
||Discord is: Half-Blood Quinn#4773

tags: He needs his greasy black hair for his image!
summary: I love me the good and soft Severitus where Harry gives his dad heart attacks at least 34 times a day but still gives him cute...
question: I love me the good and soft Severitus where Harry gives his dad heart attacks at least 34 times a day but still gives him cute things he finds or makes because why not -bethANY
answer:
I see I wasn’t the only one drowning in bibmob’s severitus art Bethany. Good to know and I’m happy to oblige.

- Harry climbs up the apple tree and Severus nearly wasn’t on time to catch him when he fell. Snape didn’t have the wits about him to draw a wand but instead ran so fast Minerva thought he apparated. Harry landed on Severus’ arm and the resulting crack made Harry cry. 

- Harry held up an apple while he cried saying that Charlie mentioned the apple in the highest branch was the sweetest and he wanted to give Severus the sweetest apple because then maybe Severus would eat more and Poppy would stop lecturing Severus that he doesn’t eat enough. Also, Harry heard that eating apples kept the healers away and Harry wanted to save Severus from Poppy.

- Poppy was very smug as she fixed his arm. Kind of insulted too, but mostly smug.

- Severus learned a very important lesson when he was playing hide and seek with Harry. It was to set a clear line of where Harry can go and can’t go. He didn’t need a repeat of playing in the dungeons and then anxiously dragging the ghosts to help him find the child. Harry was in the Headmaster’s office eating sweets he was not allowed and forgot they were playing a game.

- Severus also practically begged Molly for the charm she uses to keep her children within a certain distance only from her. A magical invisible leash so to speak. This was after the incident where Severus  lost Harry in the forbidden forest while foraging. He wanted to faint when Harry appeared by his side. He held on to his sanity and consciousness because Harry was so happy and giving him stones he found and blabbing about where he got them and why. Severus gave a lecture but kept the stones as paperweight. 

- Severus nearly had an aneurysm when Harry came into their quarters with an armful of VERY toxic plants. Harry assured him that his son is not an idiot and he knows how to handle these plants thank you very much professor.

- Minerva had the nerve to give Harry a REAL broom before he reached eleven. Severus wanted to breathe in a bag or have Poppy stay close to him lest his heart stop. He nearly threw up and Harry laughed at him before doing a loop and landing beside Severus.

- Harry exploded many cauldrons and at least there Severus knew what to do. He wasn’t as harsh but his lecturing was not gentle to say the least. His heart was along side the molten cauldron when Harry said he just wanted to be like Severus.

-Severus was ready to raise hell when he saw Ron and Harry racing with their brooms and doing stunts. Molly assured him that it was all okay and that they are safe and that it was all part of growing up. 

- Whenever Harry was crying, Severus would put his hand on his cheek, mirroring what Harry had done to him so man years ago. It always calmed Harry and Severus.

- Disappointing Severus was worse than having him angry. Lectures were better than the cold silence. Harry learned to bend Severus’ lines but never break them.

- Severus was sure he’ll have a full head of grey before Harry turns eleven by which point he’ll start going bald.

- Despite being a Hogwarts professor, he felt oddly sad when Harry insisted on boarding the express. He didn’t understand the sadness as he waved to his son goodbye. It felt like he was saying goodbye and as he apparated back near Hogwarts he realized that in a way, it was.

He held on to his sanity and consciousness because Harry was so happy and giving him stones he found and blabbing about where he got them and why. Severus gave a lecture but kept the stones as paperweight. 

- Severus nearly had an aneurysm when Harry came into their quarters with an armful of VERY toxic plants. Harry assured him that his son is not an idiot and he knows how to handle these plants thank you very much professor.

- Minerva had the nerve to give Harry a REAL broom before he reached eleven. Severus wanted to breathe in a bag or have Poppy stay close to him lest his heart stop. He nearly threw up and Harry laughed at him before doing a loop and landing beside Severus.

- Harry exploded many cauldrons and at least there Severus knew what to do. He wasn’t as harsh but his lecturing was not gentle to say the least. His heart was along side the molten cauldron when Harry said he just wanted to be like Severus.

-Severus was ready to raise hell when he saw Ron and Harry racing with their brooms and doing stunts. Molly assured him that it was all okay and that they are safe and that it was all part of growing up. 

- Whenever Harry was crying, Severus would put his hand on his cheek, mirroring what Harry had done to him so man years ago. It always calmed Harry and Severus.

- Disappointing Severus was worse than having him angry. Lectures were better than the cold silence. Harry learned to bend Severus’ lines but never break them.

- Severus was sure he’ll have a full head of grey before Harry turns eleven by which point he’ll start going bald.

- Despite being a Hogwarts professor, he felt oddly sad when Harry insisted on boarding the express. He didn’t understand the sadness as he waved to his son goodbye. It felt like he was saying goodbye and as he apparated back near Hogwarts he realized that in a way, it was.
trail.content:
I see I wasn’t the only one drowning in bibmob’s severitus art Bethany. Good to know and I’m happy to oblige.

- Harry climbs up the apple tree and Severus nearly wasn’t on time to catch him when he fell. Snape didn’t have the wits about him to draw a wand but instead ran so fast Minerva thought he apparated. Harry landed on Severus’ arm and the resulting crack made Harry cry. 

- Harry held up an apple while he cried saying that Charlie mentioned the apple in the highest branch was the sweetest and he wanted to give Severus the sweetest apple because then maybe Severus would eat more and Poppy would stop lecturing Severus that he doesn’t eat enough. Also, Harry heard that eating apples kept the healers away and Harry wanted to save Severus from Poppy.

- Poppy was very smug as she fixed his arm. Kind of insulted too, but mostly smug.

- Severus learned a very important lesson when he was playing hide and seek with Harry. It was to set a clear line of where Harry can go and can’t go. He didn’t need a repeat of playing in the dungeons and then anxiously dragging the ghosts to help him find the child. Harry was in the Headmaster’s office eating sweets he was not allowed and forgot they were playing a game.

- Severus also practically begged Molly for the charm she uses to keep her children within a certain distance only from her. A magical invisible leash so to speak. This was after the incident where Severus  lost Harry in the forbidden forest while foraging. He wanted to faint when Harry appeared by his side. He held on to his sanity and consciousness because Harry was so happy and giving him stones he found and blabbing about where he got them and why. Severus gave a lecture but kept the stones as paperweight. 

- Severus nearly had an aneurysm when Harry came into their quarters with an armful of VERY toxic plants. Harry assured him that his son is not an idiot and he knows how to handle these plants thank you very much professor.

- Minerva had the nerve to give Harry a REAL broom before he reached eleven. Severus wanted to breathe in a bag or have Poppy stay close to him lest his heart stop. He nearly threw up and Harry laughed at him before doing a loop and landing beside Severus.

- Harry exploded many cauldrons and at least there Severus knew what to do. He wasn’t as harsh but his lecturing was not gentle to say the least. His heart was along side the molten cauldron when Harry said he just wanted to be like Severus.

-Severus was ready to raise hell when he saw Ron and Harry racing with their brooms and doing stunts. Molly assured him that it was all okay and that they are safe and that it was all part of growing up. 

- Whenever Harry was crying, Severus would put his hand on his cheek, mirroring what Harry had done to him so man years ago. It always calmed Harry and Severus.

- Disappointing Severus was worse than having him angry. Lectures were better than the cold silence. Harry learned to bend Severus’ lines but never break them.

- Severus was sure he’ll have a full head of grey before Harry turns eleven by which point he’ll start going bald.

- Despite being a Hogwarts professor, he felt oddly sad when Harry insisted on boarding the express. He didn’t understand the sadness as he waved to his son goodbye. It felt like he was saying goodbye and as he apparated back near Hogwarts he realized that in a way, it was.
